bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John R. and Ida E. Kissinger, December 1, 1944

div1.p: Hench requests Kissinger's help in identifying persons and buildings in two photographs.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John R. and Ida E. Kissinger, December 1, 1944
div1.opener:
PSH/cb
1 December, 1944
Mr. and Mrs. John R. Kissinger
Rural Route No. 8
Huntington, Indiana
My dear Mr. and Mrs. Kissinger:
div1.p:
It has been a long time since I have heard from you. I have
been wondering often how Mr. Kissinger is and sincerely hope that he is
in fairly good health.

I am enclosing a letter that I have just sent to Doctor Cooke.
I am especially anxious to have you tell me whether figure No. 4 may be
Mr. Kissinger, and if you can identify any of the others, I would be most
grateful. Also, Mr. Kissinger, can you recognize the little buildings in
the other photograph? I am most anxious to have your identification.

I have been here at this hospital for almost a year, as Chief
of the Medical Service and Director of the Rheumatism Center. My family
are living in Rochester and I have a wonderful little baby boy about
eighteen months old, born in Colorado Springs, on his Grandfather Hench's
birthday, February 21, 1943. I was not able to be home at Christmas
last year, as I was stationed at the Walter Reed Hospital in Washington.
I am most excited about going home this Christmas, to be with my four
children and my wife. Our family often speak of you both. Mr. Moran visit-
ed Rochester a few months ago, bringing his wife there as a patient.

I visited General Kean in Washington about three weeks ago.
He asked of you and I regretted not knowing how you were.

Would you like to have any more copies of my article in
Hygeia, with the colored reproduction of the Yellow Fever painting?
I have quite a lot of them at home, and would be delighted to send you
as many as you wish: 25, 50, even 100, as many of them as you want.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, PHILIP S. HENCH, Lt. Col., M.C.
Chief of the Medical Service Enc.-cc ltr sent to Dr. Cooke.
